1:
I will sing of Yahweh's acts of covenant faithfulness forever.\q I will proclaim your truthfulness to future generations.
\q
2:
For I have said, "Covenant faithfulness has been established forever;\q your truthfulness you have established in the heavens."


\q
3:
"I have made a covenant with my chosen one,\q I have made an oath to David my servant.
\q
4:
I will establish your descendants forever,\q and I will establish your throne through all generations."
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
5:
The heavens praise your wonders, Yahweh;\q your truthfulness is praised in the assembly of the holy ones.
\q
6:
For who in the skies can be compared to Yahweh?\q Who among the sons of the gods is like Yahweh?


\q
7:
He is a God who is greatly honored in the council of the holy ones\q and is awesome among all who surround him.
\q
8:
Yahweh God of hosts,\q who is strong like you, Yahweh?
\q Your truthfulness surrounds you.


\q
9:
You rule the raging sea;\q when the waves surge, you calm them.
\q
10:
You crushed Rahab as one who is killed.\q You scattered your enemies with your strong arm.


\q
11:
The heavens belong to you, and the earth also.\q You made the world and all it contains.
\q
12:
You created the north and the south.\q Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.


\q
13:
You have a mighty arm\q and a strong hand, and your right hand is high.
\q
14:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.\q Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness come before you.


\q
15:
Blessed are the people who worship you!\q Yahweh, they walk in the light of your face.
\q
16:
They rejoice in your name all day long,\q and in your righteousness they exalt you.


\q
17:
You are their majestic strength,\q and by your favor we are victorious.
\q
18:
For our shield belongs to Yahweh;\q our king belongs to the Holy One of Israel.


\q
19:
Long ago you spoke in a vision to your faithful ones \f +\ft Many mss have the singular \fqa faithful one\fqa* instead of \fqa faithful ones.\f*;\q you said, "I have set a crown on a mighty one\f + \ft The MT has \fqa I will place help upon a warrior\fqa*. Some translate the word for \fqa help \fqa* as \fqa crown, which is followed by the ULB here.\f*"
\q I have raised up one chosen from among the people.
\q
20:
I have chosen David my servant;\q with my holy oil have I anointed him.
\q
21:
My hand will support him;\q my arm will strengthen him.
\q
22:
No enemy will deceive him;\q no son of wickedness will oppress him.
\q
23:
I will crush his enemies before him;\q I will kill those who hate him.


\q
24:
My truth and my covenant faithfulness will be with him;\q by my name he will be victorious.
\q
25:
I will place his hand over the sea\q and his right hand over the rivers.
\q
26:
He will call out to me, 'You are my Father,\q my God, and the rock of my salvation.'


\q
27:
I also will place him as my firstborn son,\q the most exalted of the kings of the earth.
\q
28:
I will extend my covenant faithfulness to him forever;\q and my covenant with him will be secure.
\q
29:
I will make his descendants endure forever\q and his throne as enduring as the skies above.


\q
30:
If his children forsake my law\q and do not walk in my regulations,
\q
31:
if they break my rules\q and do not keep my commands,
\q
32:
then will I punish their rebellion with a rod\q and their iniquity with blows.


\q
33:
But I will not remove my steadfast love from him\q or be unfaithful to my promise.
\q
34:
I will not break my covenant\q or change the words of my lips.


\q
35:
Once and for all I have sworn by my holinessâ€”
\q I will not lie to David:
\q
36:
his descendants will continue forever\q and his throne as long as the sun before me.
\q
37:
It will be established forever like the moon,\q the faithful witness in the sky."
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
38:
But you have refused and rejected;\q you have been angry with your anointed king.
\q
39:
You have renounced the covenant of your servant.\q You have desecrated his crown on the ground.
\q
40:
You have broken down all his walls.\q You have ruined his strongholds.


\q
41:
All who pass by have robbed him.\q He has become an object of disgust to his neighbors.
\q
42:
You have raised the right hand of his enemies;\q you have made all his enemies rejoice.
\q
43:
You turn back the edge of his sword\q and have not made him stand when in battle.


\q
44:
You have brought his splendor to an end;\q you have brought down his throne to the ground.
\q
45:
You have shortened the days of his youth.\q You have covered him with shame.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
46:
How long, Yahweh? Will you hide yourself, forever?\q How long will your anger burn like fire?
\q
47:
Oh, think about how short my time is,\q and for what uselessness you have created all the children of mankind!
\q
48:
Who can live and not die,\q or rescue his own life from the hand of Sheol?
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
49:
Lord, where are your former acts of covenant faithfulness\q that you swore to David in your truthfulness?
\q
50:
Call to mind, Lord, the mocking directed against your servants\q and how I bear in my heart so many insults from the nations.
\q
51:
Your enemies hurl insults, Yahweh;\q they mock the footsteps of your anointed one.


\q
52:
Blessed be Yahweh forever.\q Amen and Amen.



\ms Book Four
